greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows in which row n lists the middle divisors of n, or 0 if there are no middle divisors of n.
comment: The middle divisors of n are the divisors in the half-open interval [sqrt(n/2), sqrt(n*2)).
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..14002 (rows 1 <= n <= 10^4)
example: For n = 6 the middle divisors of 6 are 2 and 3, so row 6 is [2, 3].
For n = 7 there are no middle divisors of 7, so row 7 is [0].
For n = 8 the middle divisor of 8 is 2, so row 8 is [2].
mathematica: Table[Select[Divisors@ n, Sqrt[n/2] <= # < Sqrt[2 n] &] /. {} -> {0}, {n, 80}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 14 2018 *)
xref: The number of nonzero terms in row n is A067742(n).
Indices of the rows where there are zeros give A071561.
Indices of the rows where there are nonzero terms give A071562.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jun 08 2018
